author: Times Of India
title: Meenakshi Temple: Meenakshi Temple Offerings Cross 1.1 Crore | Madurai News - Times of India
text: Madurai: The monthly hundial collection at Sri Meenakshi Sundareswarar Temple in Madurai city and its 10 satellite temples crossed 1.1 crore in cash in the past month. It also achieved the 1 crore mark for the second month in a row.In a statement, S Krishnan, joint commissioner/executive officer of the temple, stated that the counting of the hundial collection was carried out on Wednesday in the presence of the temple trustees, officials from the Hindu religious and charitable endowments (HR & CE) department, temple supervisors, bank staff, and temple workers, among others. The total hundial collection amounted to 1,13,92,350 in cash. Further, 397g of gold articles, 548g of silver articles and 253 foreign currency notes were also collected. During the Chithirai festival, the temple hundial collection crossed 1.2 crore.We also published the following articles recentlyDevotees stop demolition of temple in UjjainDistrict administration's road-widening drive in Ujjain's Nayapura area faced resistance from Digambar Jain community over the demolition of the 500-year-old Parshvanath Digambar Jain temple, claimed as a heritage monument.110521411This temple in India is home to 25,000 rats!The Karni Mata Temple in Deshnok, located in Rajasthans Thar Desert, is a unique shrine known for its thousands of holy rats. The temple blurs the line between the divine and earthly, with a rich history dating back to the 14th century.110419908Janhvi Kapoor visits Muppathamman temple in ChennaiBollywood actress Janhvi Kapoor visited Muppathamman temple in Chennai, her late mother's favorite place, with actress Maheswari, ahead of the release of 'Mr And Mrs Mahi' on May 31, 2024.110459096

author: Victoria Kennedy
title: Hollow Knight: Silksong release window finally narrowed down, coming to Switch 2
text:
Silksong will release this year This is not a drill. During this afternoon's Nintendo Direct dedicated to Switch 2, we got the briefest of looks at Silksong. Yes, guys, it finally happened.
Now, by brief, I really mean brief. Silksong was shared as part of a collection of games coming to the console in the future.
BUT, here is where the news is at. Along with this snippet, Nintendo confirmed Silksong will be released this year. A 2025 date was attached to the snippet. So, yes, it isn't exactly a super firm release date, but it's much moreâ€¦
Victoria Kennedy

author: armenpress.am
title: "Gardman-Shirvan-Nakhijevan" welcomes statement from Lemkin Genocide Prevention Institute | ARMENPRESS Armenian News Agency
text:
YEREVAN, APRIL 18, ARMENPRESS. The Gardman-Shirvan-Nakhijevan Pan-Armenian Union has welcomed the statement of the Lemkin Institute for Genocide Prevention, considering it a vigilant assessment of the situation surrounding Armenia by the most important center for the study of the crime of genocide.
The statement issued by the Union reads as follows:
The Lemkin Institute for Genocide Prevention has issued a statement, sounding an alarm, taking into account the escalating rhetoric and demands of Azerbaijan and the latest attacks on the sovereign territory of Armenia.
 The statement mentions that, as assumed from many previous publications, the threat of genocide has spread to the sovereign territory of the Republic of Armenia itself. The institute emphasized that Azerbaijan, pursuing a strategy of gradual occupation of Armenian sovereign territory, aims to fully control the Armenian state and unite Azerbaijan with Turkey. Azerbaijan implements its territorial demands through the threat of military aggression and employs anti-Armenian rhetoric.
The institute emphasizes that the threat to Armenia has become urgent, demanding the immediate and systematic attention of the international community. Urgent actions are imperative to prevent another case of territorial occupation and genocide, similar to what occurred six months ago in Nagorno-Karabakh.
The Gardman-Shirvan-Nakhijevan Pan-Armenian Union also emphasizes the need for urgent response from international responsible centers.''
According to the Union, this response should be based on a theoretical unbiased analysis of Azerbaijani threats, such as today's assessments by the Lemkin Institute for Genocide Prevention.

organizations.name: lemkin genocide prevention institute | armenpress armenian news agency
